block.p: Amy Jennifer Satin, a daughter of Roberta and Irwin Satin of West Orange, N.J., was married on Monday to Alexander Michael Spinelli, a son of Eva Spinelli and James Spinelli, both of Scarsdale, N.Y. Rabbi Marc Jagolinzer performed the ceremony at the Castle Hill Inn and Resort in Newport, R.I.

Mrs. Satin Spinelli, 29, is the vice president for business development at Learn Technologies Interactive, a software company in New York. She graduated summa cum laude from Colgate University and received a law degree cum laude from Harvard. Her father, who is retired, owned General Communications and Electronics, a former store in Pine Brook, N.J. Her mother, also retired, taught computer skills at Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Elementary School in New York.

Amy Jennifer Satin, a daughter of Roberta and Irwin Satin of West Orange, N.J., was married on Monday to Alexander Michael Spinelli, a son of Eva Spinelli and James Spinelli, both of Scarsdale, N.Y. Rabbi Marc Jagolinzer performed the ceremony at the Castle Hill Inn and Resort in Newport, R.I.

Mrs. Satin Spinelli, 29, is the vice president for business development at Learn Technologies Interactive, a software company in New York. She graduated summa cum laude from Colgate University and received a law degree cum laude from Harvard. Her father, who is retired, owned General Communications and Electronics, a former store in Pine Brook, N.J. Her mother, also retired, taught computer skills at Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Elementary School in New York.

Mr. Spinelli, 27, is the chief technology officer at WeMedia, a media company in Manhattan that focuses on people with disabilities. He graduated from Fordham University. His mother is the executive administrative dean at Touro College in Manhattan. His father works in Brooklyn as the technology director of the Board of Education.
